in 1995 columbia tristar television a

Entertainment was attempting to

recently merged into one studio and they
had found success producing shows such
as mad about you and The Nanny a third

into Columbia TriStar merv griffin
enterprises which specialized in the
production of game shows such as
jeopardy and weal fortune on top of this
columbia tristar purchase libraries of
older television shows to bulk up their
library finally a television animation
division of Sony named Adelaide
productions would produce animated shows
for the company the studio entered

television series and a cartoon named

in 1977 a schoolteacher by the name of
Ron ro Decker awoke from a quadruple
bypass surgery the potentially
life-threatening operation had instilled
in Ron a sense of regret he said quote
if I had died right then my epitaph
would have read could have been an
artist always interested in drawing the
47 year-old felt that he had not pursued
his creative passion enough while in the
hospital he began sketching drawing
dragons explaining that they were a
beast that symbolized the forces in life
too big to control Ron made the decision
to pursue his art on the side continuing
this teaching career while entering arts
festivals in 1978 he continued to draw
now losing interest in the ferocious
magical beasts seven years later in 1985
while visiting a flea market
Ron stumbled upon the book the
Encyclopedia of legendary creatures
which greatly helps him perfect his
dragons he would begin painting the
beasts and water colors continuing to
show them at festivals Ron would make a
series of short independent books about
the creatures called dragon land so it
went for another decade with Ron
continuing his career as an educator and
pursuing his art on the side that would
all change one fateful day in 1995 while
he was sitting at his booth at an Arts
Festival and the secretary from Sony
Pictures Entertainment walked by she was
especially drawn to one image of a
dragon reading a bedtime story to a
young child she loved Ron's art asking
him if he'd be willing to meet with her
boss and come up with a story
surrounding the Dragons for a potential
TV series of course Ron jumped on the
opportunity using the simple plots of
his dragon land books to write the pitch
he met with the Sony executive Jim Cohen
explaining that his stories could be a
way to quote teach children to meet new
situations with confidence in Ron's mind
dragons could be viewed as either
ferocious enemies or powerful allies
depending on the viewer and a simplified
take on this for children in which
dragons could help them learn lessons
and approach situations would make for a
great television show Ron said quote
dragons are with us in one form or
another but we have the choice with how
we live with them they can engender fear
and hopelessness or challenge growth and
risk I choose to view and portray them
as the latter Coen was impressed but he
told Ron that the chances were slim to
none that the show would ever come of
his idea this was just the nature of the
television industry and on top of this
Sony didn't specialize in producing
content for children's television making
green-lighting the show even more
challenging Cohen told Ron that he would
try his best and the two parted ways
fate clearly being on the side of the
kind schoolteacher would bring the Sony
executive completely coincidentally into
the same room as a representative from
the children's television workshop the
chance encounter was spent by Cohen
explaining Ron's idea and asking if ctw
the creators of Sesame Street and the
biggest name and children's television
would be willing to co-produce the show
with columbia tristar television
distribution the representative loved
the Dragonland idea and after developing
the pitch further columbia tristar and
ctw entered an agreement to produce an
animated show together named dragon
tales with ron coming on as a series
creator and producer the two companies
sought funding from the Public
Broadcasting Corporation with television
star and producer Wesley Yura writing
the show's treatment along with a
companion series show and tell me which
would never come to fruition On January
9th 1996 it was announced that the new
series Dragon Tales was granted 4.2
million dollars for a 40 episode first
season this was part of an 8.4 million
dollar grant payout with the other half
of the sum going to the development of a
reading comprehension show named between
the lions
Dragon Tales would also be produced for
Canada's public television station cbc
ron helped create the designs for each
dragon character in the show the result
was not the same as his art with the
main difference being the characters
scale and the characters scales he
explained that the dragons design shape
and feel for the show were inspired by
his golden retrievers
as they provided a lovable and
child-friendly source Korean animation
studio yeren productions was hired to
animate the show the show's thesis was
quote what Sesame Street is for academic
readiness Dragon Tales will be for
emotional readiness and the show's
target demographic were children between
the ages of 2 & 7 the Studios went to
work creating the first 40 episodes of
the show and on September 6 1999 nearly
four years after receiving its initial
funding Dragon Tales premiered on PBS
in scale and that's what started Dragon
Tales super climbed on the backs of the

in the first season of Dragon Tales each
25-minute episode of the show was split
into two 12-minute parts each containing
an isolated story the first story of the
show's first episode was titled to fly
with dragons it started with the show's
main characters siblings Emmy and Max
voiced by andrea libman and Danny
MacKinnon respectively moving into their
new house Emmy is excited about the move
but max is hesitant he cheers up as they
enter their brand-new playroom with
dragon wallpaper just like an Emmys
Dragon book the to find a secret drawer
containing a box with dragons on it they
open up the box to find an authentic
dragon scale Emmy reads a rhyme to say
while holding the object suddenly the
dragons on the walls come to life
spiraling around Emmy and Max as they
are transported to the magical world of
Dragon land here they meet Ord
in easily frightened blue dragon voiced
by Ty Olson and Cassie a shy and kind
pink dragon voiced by Chantal strand

of the stories tried to teach lessons

such as problem-solving try new things
and compromise being explored the
producers felt that it was important
that the show not pretend to give simple
solutions to all of these problems but
to instead show ways to make the
situations more manageable the progress
was visualized through the dragon badges
worn by the characters boards dragon
badge would glow when he faced his fears
Cassie's dragon badge would glow when
she felt confident and Zak and wheezie

more dragons will be introduced
throughout the show's run some appearing
more than once new episodes of Dragon
Tales would premiere daily with 20
episodes being released from September 6
to October 22nd 10 more episodes would
air in January of 2000 the remaining 10
would air in April Dragon Tales was an
immediate hit and the show would be
renewed for a second season of 25
episodes the main difference between
season 1 and season 2 was the transition
from cel animation in which frames are
composited on layers of transparent
plastic cells to digital ink and paint
animation in which the compositing and
colouring are done digitally this
resulted in a subtle change but when
compared the second season's animation
has a noticeably cleaner and more
vibrant look the show would also bring
along a line of merchandise including a
Game Boy Color game released in December
of 2000 books based on the series
musical albums and a variety of toys the
second season of Dragon Tales premiered
on June 4th 2001 the first 10 episodes
would premiere throughout June in the
sixth episode of the second season a new
Dragon student at school in the sky was
introduced lorca a pink dragon with a
disability the creator's made sure that
work his disability was not the focus of
her character and in most episodes that
she appeared her disability was
irrelevant to the plot season 2 of
Dragon Tales would continue airing in
September of 2001 airing the seasons
20th episode on September 14 2001 the
remaining five episodes wouldn't air
until the next year picking up the exact
same week in September that the show was
most likely supposed to air in 2001 the
year-long hiatus before the final
episodes of the season could have
possibly been due to the terrorist
attacks of September 11th which occurred
the week the Dragon Tales went on hiatus
after the tragedy many networks pulled
programming either due to content
concerns or scheduling changes while the
Dragon Tales episode certainly did not
have any imagery relating to the attacks
PBS stations around the country
drastically changed their programming
schedules some running news programming
non-stop while others chose to air PBS
KIDS shows throughout the day as they
scramble to find consistent programming
after the events it is possible that
during this time it was decided to delay
the new Dragon Tales episodes although
this has never been confirmed and the
hiatus could have been coincidental the
final episode of Dragon Tales second
season premiered on October 5

Tales would continue airing on PBS until
late 2010 ending Dragon Tales 11-year
run Dragon Tales was an incredibly
successful show for PBS being nominated
for three Daytime Emmys and becoming
PBS's number one preschool program
within its first year on the air the
show help children tackle difficult
social situations in a realistic and
entertaining way the show also
introduced many children's some of the
differences in similarities between
Hispanic culture and their own in a
natural and positive fashion the
approach the show had to its conflicts
alone was unique and effective providing
its audiences with tools rather than
answers Dragon Tales at a positive
impact on a generation of children
developing social skills in the show's
colorful setting encourage children to
use their imaginations and take their
own trip to dragon land after the show
ended Ron returned to touring arts
festivals with his dragon paintings he
was constantly recognized for his work
on the show and the Dragons and his art
caught the attention of many passers-by
despite this he still sold his art for a
small price enjoined seen people
appreciate his dragons Dragon Tales had
both humble beginnings and humble
endings and Ron remembers his time on
the show fondly reminiscing with the
children visiting his booth who were
mesmerised at the dragons with which
they grew up
Ron's are had a deep emotional impact
possibly Illustrated best when a friend

Ron quote I am fading into that picture
he wasn't the only one
